intro: Reholttumia oxyoura, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. It has a short stem and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
